events.title: Lord Melbourne loses a vote of no confidence in parliament

movie.title: The Young Victoria
movie.plot: As the only legitimate heir of England's King William, teenage Victoria gets caught up in the political machinations of her own family. Victoria's mother wants her to sign a regency order, while her Belgian uncle schemes to arrange a marriage between the future monarch and Prince Albert, the man who will become the love of her life.

movie.title: Finding Neverland
movie.plot: During a writing slump, playwright J.M. Barrie meets a widow and her three children—who soon become an important part of Barrie’s life and the inspiration that lead him to create his masterpiece. Peter Pan'.

events.title: Mary Poppins premiers at Grauman's Chinese Theatre

movie.title: Saving Mr. Banks
movie.plot: Author P.L. Travers travels from London to Hollywood as Walt Disney Pictures adapts her novel Mary Poppins for the big screen.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 14 wins & 72 nominations.

movie.title: A Futile and Stupid Gesture
movie.plot: The National Lampoon name became globally recognized after the monumental success of Animal House—but before the glory days, it was a scrappy yet divinely subversive magazine and radio show that introduced the world to comedic geniuses like Bill Murray, Chevy Chase, John Belushi, and Gilda Radner. The driving force behind National Lampoon was Doug Kenney (Will Forte), and his truly wild and crazy story unfolds in A Futile and Stupid Gesture from Harvard to Hollywood to Caddyshack and beyond.

movie.title: Prayers for Bobby
movie.plot: Bobby Griffith was his mother's favorite son, the perfect all-American boy growing up under deeply religious influences in Walnut Creek, California. Bobby was also gay. Struggling with a conflict no one knew of much less understood Bobby finally came out to his family.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 4 wins & 13 nominations.

movie.title: Find Me Guilty
movie.plot: Based on the true story of Jack DiNorscio, a mobster who defended himself in court for what would be the longest mafia trial in U.S. history.

movie.title: The Most Hated Woman in America
movie.plot: The true story of Madalyn Murray O'Hair -- iconoclast, opportunist, and outspoken atheist -- from her controversial rise to her untimely demise.
